div.ab:
على هاشم بــن پپــ ثمــن لـــه دينارين وثلث

ثلثي دينار ودانق

على جعفر بن يزيد أعزّه اللّه ثمــن عمامة خز كحلا ديــنــار إلّا قيراط
على أبي ثمــن عمامة حمرا ثلثي دينار وقيراط

For account of Hâ[šim ] i[bn ... pri]ce of a ... [...] ... two dînârs and a third.
〚For account of Abû Ǧuʿail price of a saddle-cloth two dînârs and a half carat〛.
〚For account of Abû Ǧamîl price of a saddle-cloth (viz. a horse-cloth) two dînârs and one and a half carat〛.
For account of Abû Kâ[mil] pri[ce of ... ...] .. four and a half dînârs and one carat.
For account of Abû Ǧam[îl] price of a ... ... from Baġdâ]d two dînârs.
For account of Abû Babâ [price of a co]rd from Ṭabaristân eighteen carats.
For account of Abû Ǧamîl [price of three co]ifs one and a half dînâr[
For account of Abû Šuǧâʿ price of a girdl[e from Ṭabari]stân [...] ... three dînârs and one carat.
and Abû Siʿr
For account of Aḥmad b. Ǧaʿfar price of a saddle-cloth (viz.) a horse-cloth, two thirds of a dînâr and one [ca]r[at].
For account of Abû ʿImrân price of a saddle-cloth (viz.) a horse-cloth, ten carats and one dâniq.
For account of Abû Ḥafṣ price of a pillow from Ṭabaristân fifteen dînârs.
[For account of] al-[Faḍl price of th]r[ee] coifs of satin three and a third dînârs.
[... ibn Baqqâr].
[...]... f[our dînârs and] ... carats.
[...] two thirds of a dînâr and one dâniq.
[... fo]urteen carats and one dâniq.
For account of Ǧaʿfar b. [Yazîd] - may God [exalt him -] price of a black turban of velvet one dî[n]âr less one carat.
For account of Abû [... pri]ce of a red turban two thirds of a dînâr and one carat.
For account of al-[Faḍl b. Baqqâr pri]ce of a blackish turban of velvet one dînâr and two carats and one dâniq.
[For acco]unt of Abû Ḥasan and al-Kîlî price of a caftan of velvet from Nîsâbûr three dînârs and one carat and one dâniq.
〚Abû ʿImrân〛 from Barlûd (?).
[F]or account of Abu'z-Zayyât price of a blackish tunic of velvet nine dînârs and five [cara]ts.
For account of Abû Ḥafṣ, whom God may exalt, price of a blackish caftan of velvet seven dînârs.
For account of Abu'z-Zayyât price of a blackish upper-gown of velvet eight dînârs.
For account of al-Faḍl b. Baqqâr price of a handkerchief from Tinnîs two dînârs and one carat.
For account of Ǧaʿfar b. Yazîd price of a green upper-gown of velvet four dînârs and a third of a dînâr.
For account of Abû Ḥafṣ, price of a green tunic of velvet five dînârs less one third.
whom God may exalt,
For account of Faḫr b. al-Aṣyad price of a nice tunic of velvet three dînârs.
For account of Abû Ḥafṣ, whom God may exalt, a red caftan of velvet three and a half dînârs and one carat.
For account of Abû ʿÎsâ, whom God may exalt, a red cloak of velvet two dînârs and five carats.
For account of Abû Ḥaǧar, whom God may exalt, a green gown of velvet a half (dînâr) and one carat.
For account of Abu'l-Qâsim, originating from Aswân, price of trousers and a trouser's-band fifteen carats and half a dâniq.
For account of Abû Ǧamîl price of a ... ... ... three dînârs and one carat.
[Fo]r account [of Ab]û [... ... ... ...] price of [...]......[...]
〚For account of〛 〚 price of a ... ... ...〛
For account of Abû Ḥafṣ price of triangular ... ... two dînârs and an eighth and a half-carat..
For account of Abû ʿÎsâ, whom God may exalt, price of a gaiter seven carats.
For account of Abû Bakr, the purchaser, price of a caftan from al-Mâḥûza two dînârs and a quarter and one carat.
For account of Ḥayy, originating from Aswân, price of an upper-gown from Tust[ar two third]s of a dînâr and a quarter of a carat.
Abû Naṣr ad-Dîn.
For account of Abu'z-Zayyât, price of silk-clothes two dînârs and a sixth and a half carat.
For account of ʿAbdal[lâh, originating from] ... ... ...dalâʿ, price of a piece of cloth two carats.
For account of Abû Bakr a silver-... ... ... • five carats and one dâniq.
For account of Abû Babâ price of mats for the prayer eighteen carats.
For account of Abu'z-Zayyât price of mats for the prayer nineteen carats and one dâniq.
for his partner.
